Global_Attributes.name: platform_is_mobile
Global_Attributes.description: “false” (mobile platforms are not supported by this profile)

Global_Attributes.name: site_name
Global_Attributes.description: Name of site where data were gathered.

Global_Attributes.name: Scan_name
Global_Attributes.description: Name of scan strategy used, if applicable.

Global_Attributes.name: Scan_id
Global_Attributes.description: Scan strategy id, if applicable. Assumed 0 if missing.

Global_Attributes.name: Ray_times_increase
Global_Attributes.description: “true” or “false”. Set to true if ray times increase monotonically throughout all of the sweeps in the volume.

Global_Attributes.name: Simulated
Global_Attributes.description: “true” or “false”. Set to true if data in this file are simulated.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: volume_number
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Volume numbers are sequential, relative to some arbitrary start time, and may wrap.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: time_coverage_start
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: UTC time of first ray in file.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: time_coverage_end
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: UTC time of the last ray in the file.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: latitude
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Latitude of instrument using WGS84. For a mobile platform this is the latitude of the instrument at the start of the volume.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: longitude
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Longitude of instrument using WGS84. For a mobile platform this is the longitude of the instrument at the start of the volume.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: altitude
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Altitude of instrument above mean sea level, using WGS84 and EGM2008 geoid corrections. For a scanning radar this is the centre of rotation of the antenna. For a mobile platform this is the altitude at the start of the volume.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: platform_type
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Type of platform upon which the radar system is mounted. Allowed values are listed in Table 15.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: instrument_type
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Type of instrument. Allowed values are listed in Table 15.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: altitude_agl
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Altitude of instrument above ground level. This is the centre of rotation of the antenna.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: primary_axis
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: Principle axis of rotation. Allowed values are specified in Table 301-15.

Global_Ancillary_variables.name: status_str
Global_Ancillary_variables.description: General-purpose string for storing any information that is not included in other parts of the data structure. Any text-based encoding may be used, including simple text, XML, JSON, etc.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/time
sweep_variables.description: Coordinate variable for the time dimension. Each value is the time at centre of each ray.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/range
sweep_variables.description: Coordinate variable for the range dimension. Each value is range along beam propagation path to the centre of each range bin.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/frequency
sweep_variables.description: List of operating frequencies in Hertz. In most cases only a single frequency is used.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/sweep_number
sweep_variables.description: The index of the sweep within the volume, 0-based.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/sweep_mode
sweep_variables.description: Type of sweep that was performed. Allowed values are listed in

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/follow_mode
sweep_variables.description: Target following mode used to control antenna pointing. Allowed value are listed in Table 301-15.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/prt_mode
sweep_variables.description: Pulsing mode used for sweep. Standard allowed values are listed in Table 301-15. More complicated pulsing schemes may also be represented using a sequence of “H” and “V” characters. For example “HHVVH”.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/fixed_angle
sweep_variables.description: Target angle for the sweep. In most sweep modes this is the elevation angle, for RHI mode this is the azimuth angle.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/azimuth
sweep_variables.description: Azimuth of the antenna relative to true north at the centre of dwell for each ray of the sweep.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/elevation
sweep_variables.description: Elevation of the antenna relative to true north at the centre of dwell for each ray of the sweep.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/polarization_mode
sweep_variables.description: Polarization mode used during sweep. Allowed values are listed in Table 301-15.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/polarization_sequence
sweep_variables.description: Polarization sequence for each PRT that is used. Only applicable if prt_mode is “hybrid”. As an example, the form of it would be [‘H’,‘H’,‘V’,‘V’,‘H’] for HHVVH

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/rays_are_indexed
sweep_variables.description: Indicates whether or not the ray angles (elevation in RHI sweep mode, azimuth in other modes) are indexed to a regular grid.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/rays_angle_resolution
sweep_variables.description: If rays_are_indexed is true, this is the resolution of the angular grid (that is, the delta angle between successive rays).

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/qc_procedures
sweep_variables.description: General-purpose string for storing any information that describes the QC procedures performed on this sweep. Any text-based encoding may be used, including simple text, XML, JSON, etc.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/target_scan_rate
sweep_variables.description: Intended scan rate for this sweep. The actual scan rate is stored in scan_rate. This variable is optional. Omit if not available.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/scan_rate
sweep_variables.description: Actual antenna scan rate. Set to negative if counter-clockwise in azimuth or decreasing in elevation. Positive otherwise.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/antenna_transition
sweep_variables.description: 1 if antenna is in transition (that is, between sweeps), 0 if not. If transition rays are not included in the file this variable may be omitted.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/pulse_width
sweep_variables.description: Length of transmitted pulse.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/calib_index
sweep_variables.description: Index for the radar calibration that applies to this pulse width. The value must match one of the calibration indexes listed by

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/rx_range_resolution
sweep_variables.description: Resolution of the raw receiver samples if different to ‘meters_between_gates’. Raw data may be resampled before data storage.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/prt
sweep_variables.description: Pulse repetition time. For staggered prt, also see prt_ratio.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/prt_ratio
sweep_variables.description: Ratio of prt/prt2. For dual/staggered prt mode.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/prt_sequence
sweep_variables.description: Sequence of prts used. Optional for fixed, staggered and dual, which can make use of prt and prt_ratio. Required for more complicated pulsing schemes.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/_velocity
sweep_variables.description: Unambiguous velocity. This is the effective Nyquist velocity after unfolding. See also the field-specific attributes fold_limit_lower and fold_limit_upper.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/unambiguous_range
sweep_variables.description: Unambiguous range.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/n_samples
sweep_variables.description: Maximum number of samples used to compute moments. The actual number of samples used may vary from field to field.

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/radar_measured_transmit_power_h
sweep_variables.description: Measured transmit power H polarization

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/radar_measured_transmit_power_v
sweep_variables.description: Measured transmit power V polarization

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/radar_measured_sky_noise
sweep_variables.description: Noise measured at the receiver when connected to the antenna with no noise source connected

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/radar_measured_cold_noise
sweep_variables.description: Noise measured at the receiver when connected to the noise source, but it is not enabled

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/radar_measured_hot_noise
sweep_variables.description: Noise measured at the receiver when it is connected to the noise source and the noise source is on

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/phase_difference_ transmit_hv
sweep_variables.description: Phase difference between transmitted horizontally- and vertically- polarized signals as determined from the first valid range bins

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/antenna_pointing_ accuracy_elev
sweep_variables.description: Antenna- pointing accuracy in elevation

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/antenna_pointing_ accuracy_az
sweep_variables.description: Antenna-pointing accuracy in azimuth

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/calibration_offset_h
sweep_variables.description: Calibration offset for the horizontal channel

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/calibration_offset_v
sweep_variables.description: Calibration offset for the vertical channel

sweep_variables.name: sweep_<n>/monitoring/zdr_offset
sweep_variables.description: ZDR offset (bias)

attributes.attribute_value: Radial velocity of scatterers away from instrument H
Radial velocity of scatterers away from instrument V
Signal to noise ratio cross-polar V

radar_calibration.name: radar_calibration/dielectric_factor_used
